page.title: 02METHWOLD FENS part 2
page.content: The deeper peats are cropped with salad crops, celery, leeks and potatoes and the shallower peat with wheat, potatoes and sugar beet. there is an almost total absence of trees with the exception of some shelter hedges of willow. The Poppylot Road is notoriously uneven due to subsidence, and during the last twenty years has had to carry an increasing amount of traffic, especially heavy beet lorries during the winter months. Public transport through the area is almost non existent, one bus travelling to Ely and back on Thursdays. School children are taken to Southery and Downham Market by bus daily. Milk is delivered three times a week, and bread etc. twice or three times a week. by Mr W. A. Watkins, Larmans Fen.
